runs.comm: outside off and left alone
back of a length, nips back into Charles and he's taken on the thigh pad
width outside off but he can't put it away, when for a cut and didn't time it at all
slower ball, Charles gives himself some room and chops it down to third man
full and straight, shuffles across the crease and pushed back to the bowler
forced square off the back foot wide of point
angled in towards leg stump and it's swept away off a top edge but no one is out a deep square-leg
this one is chipped in the air down the ground, cover dives across but can't get a hand on it
big appeal for lbw, Charles went across his stumps to sweep and didn't make contact
full on off stump, comfortably driven down the ground
nicely bowled, on middle and off and it turns enough to square up Smith as he defends
another big shout! And again Richard Illingworth says not out as Smith, this time, misses an expansive sweep...looked a little closer than the first
goes for the pull, gets a bottom edge past the stumps that beats short fine-leg and Samit Patel can't quite pull it back despite a good dive
backs away to leg, drives square on the off side and there's a misfield at point by Buttler which is a rare sight
low full toss outside off, driven firmly towards point and this time Buttler makes a save
slower ball which is tucked into the leg side
full and wide, Charles drives over the top of a ball
banged in short, catches Charles a little by surprise.  His pull is unconvincing and he doesn't beat short fine-leg
takes the pad but that's going well down leg side and there isn't even an appeal
his first slower ball of the evening is handsomely dispatched over cover by Smith
drags the length back and up at 86mph, Smith punches back to the bowler
gone! Full and straight, catches Smith on the crease. Unless there was an edge that was dead
gets a bouncer first up but it's too high and wide down the leg side
angled into the right hander, takes the pad behind square and Kieswetter runs around to field
another slower ball to finish with and it beats a flat-footed poke. Excellent start from Dernbach
another bouncer, batsman ducks underneath and this time it's legal
well bowled, full on middle and off, nips back a touch, defended into the covers
loses his line the leg side
plays away from his body, gets an outside edge down to third man and Borthwick can't stop the second
a full delivery which is drilled back down the pitch with some power, but not quite the timing or placement to beat mid-off
steps away outside leg to a slower ball but can't beat the off side ring
slower ball again, and again the batsman can't get it through the off side...early pressure in the Powerplay
that turns and takes the edge but goes wide of slip
gone! Patel strikes, good work from bowler and captain. Just looked a straight ball that the batsman shuffled across to and missed. Not stone dead, but clipping leg
pushed into the off side
goes back and opens the face, takes off the quick single but it's fairly comfortable
tries to break free with a slog into the leg side but doesn't beat midwicket
excellent stuff from Patel, tossed up on off stump and it's driven into the covers
tossed up full, driven through the off side out to the sweeper
on leg stump, goes for the sweep and comes off the pad to short fine-leg
nicely tossed up and easily driven down the ground
quite close to the batsman who cuts it away to backward point
lots of air on this one, it doesn't actually pitch but only costs a single as it's driven to deep cover
low full toss outside off is heaved through midwicket and good fielding keeps them to a single
that's a beauty! Bite and turn from off stump which beats the edge
goes down on one knee and sweeps from outside off to deep midwicket
onto the back foot, played with an open face to the left of backward point
goes down very early to paddle this away but doesn't go any further than short fine-leg
that's more like it! Charles uses his feet and deposits Patel into the stands at long on. West Indies need a few more of them
now he sweeps strongly from outside off but it goes straight to deep square
another full toss and it's clubbed away over midwicket but the boundary fielder gets round
very full and driven in the air down the ground, Bresnan at long off dives and can't collect cleanly
attempts another big shot over the leg side but gets an inside edge into his boot
tossed up, drives into the off side and can't beat Bopara at cover
gone! Lovely bowling from Borthwick. Think it might have been the googly and Charles plays all around it. Indeed, it was the wrong 'un. Nice to see.
he's away first ball with a punchy drive down the ground
big turn first up, finds the inside edge as Barnwell plays forward and almost drags on
goes onto the back foot this time and works into the leg side
quicker outside off and doesn't turn, Samuels tries to dab it away and misses
uses his feet but can't beat Swann
opens the face but can't beat backward point this time
more turn, takes an inside edge into the pads and bobbles nowhere
looped up nice and high on middle and off, Barnwell defending to extra cover
Barnwell is back this time to defend back down the pitch
Borthwick has been tossing them up nicely, but this was a little too full - a full toss in fact - and it's eased down the ground with minimum fuss
much quicker and flatter from the young legspinner, prompting a slightly wild swipe towards leg from Samuels, but without much effect
a sharp single! Samuels nudged one behind square and they set off almost straight away, but this was mighty tight
plenty of flight once more, and he's tapped to long off
nicely worked with the turn by Barnwell, and he's rewarded by a single to backward square
flight! Great stuff from Swann, the ball hanging in the breeze on its way down. Samuels actually appeared to be beaten, but kept his wrists soft and managed to get the ball down to third man
cracked away for a couple into the leg side
beaten outside off! The quicker arm ball from Swann, and Barnwell was fortunate to have his bat tucked inside the line
chopped away for a couple
Barnwell makes room to guide into the off side for a single
slightly too short from Borthwick, Barnwell goes back and across to thump to deep cover
did this keep a touch low? Or was Samuels beaten by the flight? Either way, he was back when he should really have been forward, and is beaten on the bottom edge
played with the spin to cover
again Samuels tries to go through the off side, this time he threads a gap and gets a couple
there's a hint of desperation in this attempted slog sweep from Samuels as Borthwick drifts one down the leg side, but he can't get it away
Samuels makes room and cuts off the top of middle, but the fielder at cover point cleans up
full and swinging outside off, the ball is squirted through backward point for a couple
Bopara hits a length this time, and a backfoot punch goes to point
beaten on the bottom edge! Both batsmen are getting very fidgety indeed now. Barnwell lined up an expansive square drive but the ball zipped underneath the bat
close again! Barnwell walks across his stumps and tries a paddle sweep - and why not? - but the execution is poor and the ball rises just over middle and leg
slapped out into the off side
Samuels swings across the line and sends the ball to wide long on
dabbed down to short third man with the spin
beaten outside off! Barnwell attempted to repeat the stroke but a touch of turn and bounce from around the wicket is enough to beat him
and he follows that up with prodding defence. Something's gotta give!

there we go, desperation eventually gets the better of Barnwell as a heave soars into the darkening sky and is superbly caught by Hales out in the deep! That was a really good effort. He was running round the midwicket boundary even as Stokes was charging across from long on, both men slid into position but Hales was under it to complete the catch
Samuels backs away and attempts to tap one through the off side, but it's toe-ended and goes nowhere
shot! A meaty cover drive is nailed through cover, and it's hit well enough to beat the sweeper
nudged into the off side off the back foot, just the one
well, this may well have been a wide had he not flung the bat out at it, a slow legcutter from Bopara slipping quite far out on the off side
another slower one from Bopara, cutting away, and Samuels waits to dab it to third man. He seems to have raised the ire of the umpire for running straight down the pitch with that single too
flicked into the leg side for one
has he read this? A chipped drive loops over the infield at cover. Doesn't matter how you get 'em, I suppose
dicey shot! Samuels swung right across an inswinger, and is a touch fortunate as the ball finds the inside edge but rolls safely towards midwicket
he is full, fast and straight to start, and the ball tails in just a touch towards the batsman, who slaps to mid-off and really has to hustle as the shy is fired in
short and rising from the young quick bowler, and Sammy is a little rushed as he steps back to pull
slower ball from Dernbach, and Sammy doesn't even get close to it as he sets himself for an almighty heave down the ground. That's amused Dernbach
he follows that up with the effort ball. He's aimed for the base of the stumps but the ball slips out as a low, dipping full toss that is hacked through the off side
another slower one, and it's well played by Samuels. He'd given himself some room but waited on the stroke to get it down to third man
slashed! Samuels is just now starting to find some fluency. He clears the left leg, scythes through the line and collects a welcome boundary to backward point

flat-batted over long on! This was brutal from Sammy, he picked the slower one and simply clobbered the ball. It didn't even appear as though he timed it particularly well, there's just so much power in his arms
quicker from Bopara, and Sammy plays back to collect a single through mid off
fortunate for the batsman! Samuels heaves and a thick inside edge flies between the batsman and his stumps, rolling down to fine leg. West Indies need all the luck they can get
punched out through point for a couple
Samuels clears the left leg, but Bopara aims full and straight and he can only get a single to long on

another good catch in the outfield, and West Indies stumble after a brief fightback. Bopara landed one full outside off and Sammy hammered the ball in the air down to long off, where Borthwick charged across to hold the chance. "There was some heat on that," guffaws Gnasher, and he's right, it was hit very hard, but not nearly far enough
Samuels makes room and cracks to cover, but he's pinged the fielder and there's no run to be had
sharp yorker from Dernbach, and it's just about on target but Samuels was right back and dug it out into the off side
Russell brings down West Indies' 100 with a bunt down the ground, and elicits a slightly muted round of applause
slower-ball bouncer from Dernbach, and Samuels was in a bit of trouble as he swayed back, but put bat to ball to find a single
the back-of-the-hand slower ball is too good for Russell, who throws everything into a front foot swipe but doesn't get close
Dernbach ends the over and his spell with a full, fast delivery that is pushed down the ground
Bopara lands a slower ball on a length, and it's cracked back down the pitch but clatters into the stumps at the non-striker's end
another slower one, and it finds the inside edge of an attempted mow. A single is taken as the ball dribbles to short fine leg
hacked out to wide long on, and he's placed it well enough to come back for the second
Russell finds the boundary! Bopara floated this one right up to the bat and Russell's eyes lit up, the batsman smoking this one to straight long on. The ball landed just inside the rope
quicker one from Bopara - a low full toss - and it's slammed down the ground. Buttler slips as he stoops to field at long on, but recovers in time to keep them to two
good yorker to finish, and they can only get a single as Russell jams down on it
